intro: Lathyrus nevadensis var. cusickii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing adaptations to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with a spurred petal that aids in pollination by specific insect species. The variety cusickii is distinguished by its unique morphological traits, including leaf and flower structure, which set it apart from other Lathyrus species.
